item.title: World shares are mixed as traders pin hopes on a rate cut by the Fed
item.description: World shares and U.S. futures are mixed after Wall Street was buoyed by hopes for an interest rate cut by the Federal Reserve

item.title: The shutdown is over. Flights have resumed. Thanksgiving travelers might wonder: What now?
item.description: Travelers this Thanksgiving may still feel on edge after the historic government shutdown that caused widespread flight cancellations and delays

item.title: Stores keep prices down in a tough year for turkeys. Other Thanksgiving foods may cost more
item.description: Bird flu and another disease have shrunk the U.S. turkey population to a 40-year low this year

item.title: Takeoff of China's flying taxis hits turbulence
item.description: Chinese companies are rushing to deploy low-flying vehicles and drones for various uses as the country finds innovative ways to drive its economy

item.title: Tea tariffs once sparked a revolution. Now they are creating angst
